news.headline: Lam Research Q2 FY2026 earnings beat: EPS $1.27 vs $1.17 est, revenue $5.34B vs $5.21B est (+22% YoY)
news.details: Q3 FY2026 guidance: revenue $5.7B +/- $300M, non-GAAP gross margin 49% +/- 1pp, non-GAAP EPS $1.35 +/- $0.10. Guidance above consensus, driven by AI chip equipment demand.

news.headline: 5 Revealing Analyst Questions From Lam Research's Q4 Earnings Call — focus on AI-driven demand sustainability
news.details: Analysts probed sustainability of AI equipment spending, China exposure, and advanced packaging growth trajectory.

news.headline: Lam Research appoints Cadence CEO Anirudh Devgan to board; COO Patrick Lord retiring March 6, Sesha Varadarajan to assume COO role
news.details: Devgan joins Innovation and Technology Committee. COO transition is orderly — Varadarajan is a seasoned insider. Board strengthening with semiconductor design expertise.

news.headline: Lam Research stock rebounds 1.6% to $213.12 after 8.83% prior-day drop amid semiconductor equipment sell-off
news.details: Steep 9% single-day drop driven by broad semiconductor equipment rotation. Stock hit intraday low of $205.11 before partial recovery. Indicates elevated volatility.

news.headline: Lam Research declares quarterly dividend of $0.26/share
news.details: Consistent with prior dividend policy. Annualized yield ~0.45% at current price. Part of 75-100% FCF return commitment.

news.headline: DeepSeek AI sell-off hits semiconductor equipment stocks — LRCX down 5.6%, KLA -6.3%, ASML -6.5%
news.details: DeepSeek's $6M AI model raised questions about AI chip demand trajectory. Impact proved temporary — stocks rebounded within days. But highlighted market sensitivity to AI capex narrative.

news.headline: Lam Research leads AI infrastructure supercycle — WFE spending projections for 2026 revised to record $145B
news.details: CEO Tim Archer expressed confidence that memory and semiconductor equipment spending remains robust in 2026, driven by AI-related demand across NAND, DRAM, and foundry/logic.

news.headline: Lam Research announces multi-year collaboration with CEA-Leti on next-gen specialty devices (MEMS, 3D imaging, RF, photonics)
news.details: Partnership targets applications in AI and high-performance computing. Expands SAM beyond traditional etch/deposition into specialty devices.

news.headline: Jim Cramer says 'Lam Research is the future' — highlights AI infrastructure positioning
news.details: Media endorsement. Cramer bullish on Lam's positioning in AI chip manufacturing equipment cycle.

news.headline: Lam Research comments on newly announced export regulations — impact 'broadly consistent with prior expectations'
news.details: Dec 2024 U.S. export controls expansion. 50% affiliate rule restricts shipments to specific Chinese customers. Estimated $200M Q2 revenue drag, ~$600M CY2026 drag. Suppliers must find non-Chinese alternatives by end of 2025 or lose status.

news.headline: China retaliates with export controls on rare-earth metals and Chinese version of '50% rule'
news.details: China's Ministry of Commerce broadened export controls on rare earths and created deny-list mechanism. Potential supply chain disruption for semiconductor equipment manufacturers.

upcoming_catalysts.event: COO transition: Patrick Lord retires, Sesha Varadarajan assumes COO role
upcoming_catalysts.expected_impact: Neutral — orderly insider transition, already announced
High — guided revenue $5.7B (+7% QoQ), EPS $1.35. Beat/miss will be key for stock direction given elevated valuation

upcoming_catalysts.event: Potential new U.S. export control tightening under Trump administration
upcoming_catalysts.expected_impact: Negative — could expand China revenue restrictions beyond current $600M CY2026 drag estimate
upcoming_catalysts.timeline: Uncertain, could be any time in 2026

upcoming_catalysts.event: WFE spending cycle inflection — industry consensus $145B for CY2026
upcoming_catalysts.expected_impact: Positive if realized — validates AI-driven equipment supercycle thesis

upcoming_catalysts.event: NAND recovery acceleration and DRAM/HBM capacity expansion
upcoming_catalysts.expected_impact: Positive — Lam expects stronger H2 2026 driven by NAND recovery, DRAM fab readiness, and advanced logic timing
Positive — sustained EPS accretion. $1.29B bought back in Q3 FY2025 alone. 75-100% FCF return target

upcoming_catalysts.event: Advanced packaging equipment demand ramp (HBM, CoWoS)
upcoming_catalysts.expected_impact: Positive — Lam highlighted packaging gains in Q2 FY2026 earnings call as key growth driver

bull_case: AI infrastructure supercycle driving record WFE spending ($145B CY2026)
Strong earnings momentum: 22% YoY revenue growth, guidance raised
Aggressive $10B buyback program providing EPS support
All three device segments (NAND, DRAM, foundry/logic) positioned for growth
bear_case: China export controls creating ~$600M CY2026 revenue drag
Elevated valuation (fwd P/E ~36x) leaves little room for disappointment
DeepSeek episode showed market vulnerability to AI capex narrative shifts
Semiconductor equipment stocks are 'crowded trade' with negative technical divergences
China rare-earth retaliation could disrupt supply chains
